newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan 14-day NCDs average yield at 5.914 pct.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan 14-day NCDs average yield at 5.914 pct.

text.p: Taiwan's central bank, vowing to mop up excess liquidity before an upcoming holiday, issued T$3.0 billion in 14-day negotiable certificates of deposit on Thursday at an average yield of 5.914 percent.
The range of the bids was between 5.850 and 5.970 percent, a central bank official said. Demand totalled T$8 billion.
The issue was the central bank's second mop-up measure in two days.
The bank said Wednesday's issue aimed to absorb extra money before the upcoming two-day holiday on March 29-30 and was not an effort to dampen stock market turnover.
Central bank governor Sheu Yuan-dong on Monday pledged that the bank would take the economy's health into consideration in any further issues of the short-term instruments.
The central bank had made major daily NCD issues almost every day up until March 21, reportedly trying to curb the loose liquidity that many analysts said was fuelling a stock market rally.
Since then share prices had plunged over a hog epidemic sweeping the island. Shares rebounded again on Wednesday and Thursday.
